p: Δ-6-Desaturase is also present in evening primrose seeds. Huang et al. (2010) report that the cDNA sequence of the D6D gene was obtained from the developing seeds. The transformation of the plasmid DNA of a Saccharomyces cerevisiae strain then showed that after the addition of a medium containing linoleic acid to the yeast cells, a signal was obtained from γ-linolenic acid, indicating the presence of Δ-6-desaturase in seeds of the species Oenothera biennis [ 20, 21].
